ab.title: Genesis 42
ab.l: And Jacob saw that there was grain in Egypt,and Jacob said to his sons, ‘Why do you look at one another,as if you were not lacking anything? But I see that you willget into fight because of the lack of bread.’
And he said, ‘Lo, I have heard that there is grainin Egypt. Go down and buy for us grainfrom there, and let us live, and let us not die.
AndJoseph’s ten brothers went down to buy grain in Egypt.
And Jacob did not send Benjamin, Joseph’s brother,with his brothers, because he said, ‘Lestdeath befall him.’
And the sons of Israel cameto buy grain among those who were coming, becausethe famine was in the land of Canaan.
And Josephwas the one in charge over the land, he wasthe one that sold grain to all the people of the land. AndJoseph’s brothers came, and bowed down themselves with their faces to the earth.

And Joseph saw his brothers, and he recognizedthem, but he was unknown to them, and spoke rough words to them.And he said to them, ‘From where have you come?’ Andthey said, ‘From the land of Canaan to buy grain.’
And Joseph recognized his brothers, but they did not recognize him.
And Joseph remembered the dreams which he dreamedof them, and said to them, ‘You are spies.You have come to see the nakedness of the land.’
And they saidto him, ‘No, my lord, your servants have come to buy grain.
We are all one man’s sons. Weare honest. Your servants were not spies.’
And he said to them, ‘No, but you have come to see the nakedness of the land.’
And they said, ‘Your servants are twelve. We are brothers,the sons of one man in the land of Canaan, and,the young is today with our father, and oneis not.’
And Joseph said to them, ‘It is asI spoke to you, saying, “You are spies.”
By this you shall be examined: by Pharaoh’s life,if you go out from here, only when your younger brother comes hereback.
Send one of you,and let him take your brother, and you shall be imprisoned, andyour words shall be examined, whether the truth is with you. And ifnot, by Pharaoh’s life you are spies.’
And he gathered them together under guard for threedays.
And Joseph said to them thethird day, ‘Do this, and live.I fear God:
If you are honest men,let one of your brothers be imprisoned in the house of your prison,and you go, carry grain to satiate the hungerof the people of your households.
But bring your younger brotherto me and your words will be trustworthy,and you will not die.’ And they did so.
Andthey said one to another, ‘We are verily guilty concerning our brother,in that we saw the distress of his soul, when he begged us,and we did not listen. That is why this distress come to us.’
And Reuben answered them, saying, ‘Lo,did I not tell you, saying, “Do not sin against the child”?But you did not listen. And, lo, also his blood is searched.’
And they did not know that Joseph understood them, by the fact that there was an interpreterbetween them.
And he turned from them,and wept. And he returned to them again, and spoke with them, and tookfrom them Simeon, and imprisoned him before their eyes.
Then Joseph commanded, to fill their vesselswith grain, and to give every man’s silverinto his sack, and to give them provision for the way. Andthus was done for them.
And they lifted their grain andloaded them on donkeys, and departed from there.
And one of them opened his sack to give his donkey foodat the place of overnight stay and he saw his silver, and, lo,it was in the mouth of his sack.

And he said to his brothers,‘My silver is put back: and, lo, it is in my sack’s mouth!’And their hearts left them, and they were afraid, looking one at another,saying, ‘What is this that God has done to us?’
And they came to Jacob their father to the landof Canaan, and told him all that had happened them,saying,
‘The man, the lord of the land,spoke rough words to us, and took us for spiesof the land.
And we said to him, ‘We are honest,we were not spies.
We are twelvebrothers, sons of our father, one is not, and the younger is even todaywith our father in the land of Canaan.
Andthe man, the lord of the land, said to us, “By this I will knowthat you are honest: leave one of your brothers here with me,and take grain to satiate the hunger of your households,and go.
And bring your younger brotherto me, and I will know that you are honest, that you are no spies.I will give you your brother, and you shalltrade in the land.”’
And it was: they were emptyingtheir sacks, and, lo, every man’s bundle of silver was in his sack.And when they saw the bundles of their own silver,they and their father, they were afraid.
AndJacob, their father, said to them, ‘You have deprived me of my children: Josephis not, and Simeon is not, and if you take Benjamin,they will all be mourning for me.’
And Reuben saidto his father, saying, ‘You will kill my two sons, ifI do not bring him to you. Give him in my hand, and I will bringhim to you.’

And he said, ‘My son will not go downwith you, because his brother is dead, and he is left alone.If death befalls him on the way in which you will go with him: andyou will bring down my grey hair with sorrow to the grave.’
